title: Students Reach New Heights With Spaceport Nova Scotia First Launch
summary: The first launch of Canada's new spaceport is in the record books. Today a group of young Canadian STEM enthusiasts from the Arbalest Rocketry team, hailing from York University in Ontario, successfully launched their amateur high-powered rocket, named 'Goose 3,' from Spaceport Nova Scotia.

title: Europe leans on SpaceX to bridge launcher gap
summary: Europe, temporarily lacking its own access to space, plans to rely more on SpaceX to launch key science and navigation spacecraft while working to restore its launch capabilities.

title: Viasat signs deal to commercialize European airspace tracking service
summary: A group founded by European air traffic controllers has signed a deal to bring improved airspace-tracking capabilities from Viasat’s constellation to market next year.

title: China’s Landspace set for second methalox rocket launch
summary: Chinese commercial launch firm Landspace is set for a second attempt to reach orbit with its Zhuque-2 rocket July 12.

title: Space Command argues for shift from static to dynamic satellite operations
summary: In order to better keep tabs on adversaries, the U.S. military needs satellites that can actively maneuver in orbit, the deputy commander of U.S. Space Command said July 6.
